frame.name: FR_Attributed_information
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Proposition</fen> is attributed to a human <fen>Source</fen>, or is contained in an <fen>Informational_content</fen>.
<ex><t>According</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="src">the Press Trust of India</fex> <fex name="infcont">in an article published on its Web site Thursday</fex>, <fex name="pro">the woman has been identified as 31-year-old Aafia Siddiqui, who was being sought by U.S. officials last week along with two other men, including one whose last known address was in Miramar, Fla</fex>.</ex>
<ex> In addition, <t>according</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="infcont">Section I3.5b</fex>, <fex name="pro">the spacing of stud shear connectors along the length of a supporting beam shall not exceed 36?</fex>. </ex>
<ex><t>According</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="src">the Pope</fex>, <fex name="pro">Muslims believe in the same God</fex> and according to Jesus, Muslims are the greatest in Heaven.</ex>
<ex></ex>
<asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : Slight modification of the Attributed_information 1.5 frame: the Text FE is replaced by the more general Informational_content FE, as the source is often an informational content rather than a text. The Speaker FE is replaced by the more general Source FE, to include cases in which it is not clear that there was a communication.
</def-root>

FE.name: Proposition
FE.definition:
<def-root>The information attributed to the <fen>Source</fen> or contained in the <fen>Informational_content</fen>.
<ex><fex name="pro">Parents are present at and involved in the purchase or rental of games 83 percent of the time</fex>, <t>according</t> <t>to</t> a September 2000 Federal Trade Commission report </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The sentient entity who is the source of the <fen>Proposition</fen>.
<ex>With the first big batch of music now blocked from Napster's file-swapping network, the average number of songs available on the service has dropped precipitously, <t>according</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="src">at least one research company</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Informational_content
FE.definition:
<def-root>The informational content containing the <fen>Proposition</fen>. It is more general than the usual Medium FE (written or spoken material containing the message) as it is not necessarily understandable per se as containing a communicated message.
<ex>FR-EX: <t>Selon</t> <fex name="Informational_content">les informations fournies par le directeur</fex>, le réseau A aurait touché près de 3 milliards. </ex>
<ex>The son of the Syrian defense minister received 6 million barrels, <t>according</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="Informational_content">the document</fex>, worth about $3 million. </ex></def-root>
